Hi John,

I’m going through your excellent Gulp Pluralsight tutorial and have into a roadblock with gulp-filter and gulp csso.

I have

gulp.task(‘optimize’, [‘inject’, ‘images’, ‘fonts’], function () { log(‘Optimizing the javascript, css, html’);

var assets = $.useref.assets({searchPath: './'});
var templateCache = config.temp + config.templateCache.file;
var cssFilter = $.filter('**/*.css');

return gulp
    .src(config.index)
    .pipe($.plumber())
    .pipe($.inject(gulp.src(templateCache, {read: false}), {
        starttag: '<!-- inject:templates:js -->'
    }))
    .pipe(assets)
    .pipe(cssFilter)
    .pipe($.csso())
    .pipe(cssFilter.restore())
    .pipe(assets.restore())
    .pipe($.useref())
    .pipe(gulp.dest(config.build)); });

But it gives me a TypeError: undefined is not a function on this line: .pipe(cssFilter.restore())

Am I doing anything wrong?
